Package eu.unite.challenge.dataobjects

Class RecordInstance

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.unite.challenge.dataobjects.RecordInstance
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    @Immutable
public final class RecordInstance
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class reads an input line as a String, and parses it into a maximum weight maxWeight and a list of items (List<Item> items). It also keeps a mapping Map<Integer, Item> map for fast retrieval of items given their label.
    See Also:
    Item, Serialized Form

      • RecordInstance

        public RecordInstance​(int lineNo,
                      java.lang.String line)
               throws LineFormatException
        Creates a problem instance using the line number and the line itself.
        Parameters:
        lineNo - The number of line in the input file. In case of errors, it is used to direct the user to the malformed line.
        line - The line itself
        Throws:
        LineFormatException - If the line is malformed

        Parameters:
        lineNo - Line number, used to give meaningful errors
        triples - The triples part of a line, having the form (1,w1,â‚¬p1)(2,w2,â‚¬p2)...(m,wm,â‚¬pm)
        Returns:
        An instance of Matcher, matching each triple

        LineFormatException - If the triples are malformed

      • getSections

        private java.lang.String[] getSections​(int lineNo,
                                       java.lang.String line)
                                throws LineFormatException
        A line must have the form

        a : b

        where
        • a is the maximum weight of the package, and
        • b is a representation of items.

        This method splits the line using ":" into two sections:

        • section[0] = a
        • section[1] = b
        It checks there are exactly two sections, and section[0] is a valid real number

        Parameters:
        lineNo - Line number, used to give meaningful errors
        line - The line itself
        Returns:
        sections array, as explained above
        Throws:
        LineFormatException - If the line is malformed

      • getMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​Item> getMap()
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable view of map, to preserve immutability

      • getItems

        public java.util.List<Item> getItems()
